channel.title: Nature
channel.description: Nature is the foremost international weekly scientific journal in the world and is the flagship journal for Nature Portfolio. It publishes the finest peer-reviewed research in all fields of science and technology on the basis of its originality, importance, interdisciplinary interest, timeliness, accessibility, elegance and surprising conclusions. Nature publishes landmark papers, award winning news, leading comment and expert opinion on important, topical scientific news and events that enable readers to share the latest discoveries in science and evolve the discussion amongst the global scientific community.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Chemists cram record nine metals into trendy 2D material
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 04 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02839-6

MXenes, distant cousins of graphene, reach new heights of complexity — opening the way for use in advanced batteries and more.
item.dc:title: Chemists cram record nine metals into trendy 2D material
item.dc:creator: Katherine Bourzac

item.title: 3D-printed micro ion trap technology for quantum information applications
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09474-1

High-resolution 3D printing technology making use of two-photon polymerization instead of traditional machining is described, allowing low-cost and scalable production of large arrays of high-quality 3D Paul traps.
item.dc:title: 3D-printed micro ion trap technology for quantum information applications
item.dc:creator: Shuqi Xu
Xiaoxing Xia
Qian Yu
Abhinav Parakh
Sumanta Khan
Eli Megidish
